alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Haskell; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 2:24AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Haskell, Sequoyah, southwestern Adair and southeastern Cherokee Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 223 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles south of Lake Tenkiller State Park to 4 miles northeast of Tamaha to 3 miles north of Keota. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Sallisaw... Muldrow... Vian... Gans... Marble City... Brushy Lake State Park... Brushy... Bunch... Lake Tenkiller State Park... Mc Key... Box... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 294 and 319. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
